sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin praises China's plan for peace in Ukraine, but Kyiv says it falls short of its demands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: European Council President Charles Michel tells Euronews that the EU must engage with China despite their differences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: As protests continue across France, President Macron is due to give a live TV interview about the social unrest over his government's pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Rail services in Greece restarted for the first time since the tragic head-on train collision, which left 57 people dead three weeks ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Uganda passes a new bill that could mean people who identify as LGBTQ plus will face up to life in prison or even the death penalty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: One in four people around the world can't access clean drinking water, something the UN wishes to address as it marks World Water Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Beijing's 12-point peace plan to end the war in Ukraine has been described as

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: falling short on details by Ukraine and its allies. The plan, a topic of discussion between presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin at their summit in Moscow, doesn't require Russia to withdraw its troops, a basic requisite made by Kyiv. In Washington, the White House response was clear. So now if China wants to play a constructive role here in this conflict, then they ought to press Russia to pull its troops out of Ukraine and Ukrainian sovereign territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They should urge President Putin to cease bombing cities, hospitals and schools, to stop the war crimes and the atrocities and end the war today. It could happen right now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The state visit by Xi to Moscow coincided with Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's surprise visit to Kyiv, making him the first leader of Japan to visit a country in conflict since World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: During their press briefing, President Volodymyr Zelensky said he's invited China for talks on Ukraine. China has sought to portray itself as a neutral party in the Ukraine conflict, but so far there is no indication of an equivalent trip to Kyiv by President Xi Jinping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: For the President of the European Council, it's important that China doesn't support Russia with military equipment, but he still believes that Europe needs to keep the channels of communication open with Beijing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In an exclusive interview with Euronews ahead of the European summit, Charles Michel told Euronews that the Chinese peace plan is not the best solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I had this in-depth debate with President Xi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I am not naive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I know that there are close ties between China and Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But on the other hand, I think that in those circumstances, it is very clear that we need to engage with China, not because we agree on everything with China, on the contrary, but because we need to defend our interests and to defend our principles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So are you convinced by the peace plan that Beijing presented?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: our principles are you convinced by the peace plan that Beijing this peace plan is not it's not it's not what we believe in because we believe in the peace formula proposed by presidential presidency which is which is based on on the UN Charter the international law enter the the multilateral approach we also spoke with the European Council President about the economy and how to deal with the consequences of the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Watch the whole exclusive interview on Euronews from 9.30 onwards tonight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Another night of disturbances on the sidelines of a rally

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: against the French government's plan to reform the pension system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A new law, which includes a rise in the retirement age to 64, was adopted on Monday evening through Article 49 of the Constitution without a vote of MPs and after two rejected motions of no confidence in the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron has been keeping a low profile for the last few days, but has told allies he has no intention of dissolving parliament, reshuffling the government or calling a referendum on pension reform to calm tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He will also stand by his beleaguered Prime Minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Macron is due to resurface today, according to the Elysee Palace, to give a live televised interview about the social and political tensions over the pension reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But anger over the government's decision to invoke a notorious constitutional power to force the reform through the National Assembly without a vote last week has dismayed many ruling party MPs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A further day of protests and strikes is set for Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Victims of Brussels' deadliest terror attack were remembered on Wednesday morning,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: seven years after three suicide bombers killed 32 people and injured hundreds more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A minute's silence was held at both the airport and metro station where the bombs were detonated in 2016 and a list of the victims' names were called out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: This year, a 33rd name was added to the list, that of Shanti Decorte, who was euthanized last year as a result of her declining mental health after the attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Belgium's Prime Minister Alexandre Ducroix and EU Parliament President Roberta Metzola were present at the ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: On 22 December 2022, 10 men went on trial for the bombings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The case is expected to last until June and is predicted to cost 35.3 million euros, making it the most expensive trial in Belgian history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Britain's former Prime Minister Boris Johnson has admitted that he misled Parliament

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: by telling MPs that parties at his Downing Street office did not break Covid lockdown rules.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But in written evidence to a parliamentary committee, he insisted that he acted in good faith.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Johnson was fined by police for breaking the Covid rules that his own government set.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In his statement, the former Prime Minister said, In his statement, the former Prime Minister said, I did not intentionally or recklessly mislead the House on 1 December 2021, 8 December or on any other date. I would never have dreamed of doing so.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Johnson will appear in person before the committee on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: If it finds that he deliberately lied to the House of Commons, he could be suspended and ultimately face a by-election in his constituency in which he holds a slim majority of just over 7,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Johnson was forced out as Prime Minister after the latest in a series of scandals last July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The rail services are gradually resuming in Greece. Οι ραϊκές υπηρεσίες συνεχίζουν να συνεχίζουν στην Ελλάδα. Για την πρώτη φορά σε τρία εβδομάδια, οι τρανίσεις αυτοκίνησαν ξανά σε ένα χώρο που ακόμα αυτοκίνησε από την τραγική κολλησία που έκανε 57 άνθρωποι.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Για τους αυτοκίνητους, η ζωή συνεχίζεται, αφού υπήρχε ο αυτοκίνητος. I don't feel afraid. I'm prepared. I was very sorry for what happened. I've cried a lot, but now we have to work. occurred on February 28 near Clarissa, exposed the disastrous pitfalls of the railway system in Greece. The area where the tragedy occurred lacked safety systems that could have prevented the incident. Protests against the government have taken place across the country. Public pressure has shaken Greece's centre-right government and pushed them to bring forward the date of the country's general elections. Full resumption of freight and passenger trains will restart by April 11th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Uganda has passed an anti-homosexuality law that could punish those who engage in same-sex

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: relationships or even identify as LGBTQ plus to life imprisonment or the death penalty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In a turbulent session, parliament passed the bill on Tuesday and defended that it will help stop child abuse.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This bill, Madam Speaker, recognizes that same-sex attraction is not innate and immutable characteristic. It was also intended to protect our church culture, the legal, religious and traditional family values of Ugandans and acts that are likely to promote sexual promiscuity in this country rights activists and the international community have condemned the bill saying it will only provoke more attacks on the lgbtq plus community who are already facing economic back now the bill will not go on to president Moussa Vi who can choose to use his veto and maintain good relations with Western investors or sign it into law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The gargoyles and other strange and grimacing creatures of Paris' Notre Dame Cathedral are being brought back to life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Originally they were supposed to protect the cathedral from the wrath of heaven but many of them did not survive the fire in 2019. Working from photos the craftsmen and women aim to create identical copies of the Gothic originals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Notre Dame Cathedral is expected to reopen to the public in December 2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is a daily struggle for residents of Venezuela's capital, Caracas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Dozens of people wait to fill jugs of water from the stream flowing from the Wairarra Rapano Hill, where they tap water from broken pipes. We come here every two weeks to drink water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And we have to take it home every day, because it comes to us once a week for two hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The UN reports that two billion people worldwide, or a quarter of the global population, don't have access to safe drinking water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Something the United Nations wants to draw attention to as it marks World Water Day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: 10 percent of the global population currently lives in areas that are high or critical water stress.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In our report we said that up to 3.5 billion people live under conditions of water stress at least one month a year. In developing countries many problems related to drinking water are linked to rapid population growth and a lack of sanitary controls and that puts people's health at risk. It's not easy. Our children, others, they often have infections, even at the level of the front.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: I even have a sister who is pregnant at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: She recently had a chronic infection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Additionally, 1.4 million people die each year from diseases caused by water shortages or poor sanitation and hygiene.
